intro: Aeschynomene cristata, commonly known as the crownvetch, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has been introduced to other regions, including parts of the United States, where it is sometimes considered an invasive species. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it useful for soil improvement in agricultural settings.
